messages.subject: Nonsense questions---from UD's: Doing too little? WAS anti-unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/3/2005 1:25:29 A.M. Eastern Standard Time, dezigna@comcast.net writes: However  one of the great results of reading this list is it helps
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/3/2005 1:25:29 A.M. Eastern Standard Time,
dezigna@... writes:

However one of the great results of reading this list is it helps nervous
parents to stop sliding down any slippery slope that may exist. It helps us
recognize these residual school-thinks as they occur (like John Holt's
"devil teacher in me" idea), and gradually they wither from neglect. The
topics are just too broad after all because of connections. At some point we
realize that "What if they never get interested in geography (or science)?"
is a "nonsense question" in Unschooling, as unlikely an occurrence as
someone who is Unschooling wanting to know "How do you stop them from being
interested in geography?"<<<<

Or spelling.

~Kelly







[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
